required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on M2a Magnum Total Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Controlled Multi-Center Study on M2a Magnum Total Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study includes the investigation of Metal-ion release and Renal Function analysis in M2a Total Hip Arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: There are no clinical studies conducted on its performance in Asian population. Furthermore clinical data is required to support marketing and validate design of M2A Magnum.

primary_outcome.description: Hip Flexion Angle at 1 year postoperatively

secondary_outcome.description: Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.

UCLA is physician assessing scoring system to assess patient's activity level. Minimum score is 0 (completely inactive) and maximum score is 9 (Regularly participates in impact sports) with 1 point increments depending on patient's activity level. Higher score means higher activity level achieved.
number of participants, whose x-ray shows any signs of radiographic changes (osteolysis, heterotopic ossification and/or radiolucency)

Harris Hip Score is physician assessing hip functional scoring system, which includes 4 components (pain, function, deformity and range of motion) with minimum score of 0 & maximum score of 100. Maximum & Minimum score of each subscale is pain: 0-44, function: 0-47, Deformity: 0-4 and Range of motion: 0-5. Current report uses summed score of each patient to compare total Harris Hip Score. Higher score means better outcomes.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.
Blood Cobalt Ion Concentration 0 was imputed for the measurement result being below detection limit.

arm_group.description: Total HIp Arthroplasty using with the M2a Magnum Large Metal Articulation is an ultra-high performance metal-on-metal articulation with a big ball (greater than or equal to 38mm) in acetabulums as small as 44mm.

Total Hip Arthroplasty using with the M2a Taper Acetabular System consists of a titanium outer shell with cobalt chromium (Co-Cr-Mo) metallic liner, which articulates with with a cobalt chromium (Co-Cr-Mo) modular femoral head.

intervention.description: Degenerated hip is replaced with implantable devices, which include femoral stem, acetabular cup, femoral head and acetabular liner(control group only).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients suitable for primary Total Hip Replacement
- Patients aged over 20
- Patients with limited co-morbidity- ASA I-III
- Patients must be able to understand instructions and be willing to return for follow-up
- Patients willing to provide blood and urine samples for metal ion analysis at follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing metal implants
- Infection, sepsis, and osteomyelitis
- Uncooperative patient or pt with neurologic disorders who are incapable of following directions
- Osteoporosis
- Metabolic disorders which may impair bone formation
- osteomalacia
- distant foci of infections which may spread to the implant site
- rapid joint destruction, marked bone loss or bone resorption apparent on roentgenogram
- vascular insufficiency, muscular atrophy, or neuromuscular disease
- pregnancy

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Period of Recruitment was from December 2009 until December 2011. Recruitements were done at medical clinics by providing detailed explanation of procedure as well as study protocol, including randomization & right of withdrawal.

group.title: M2a Magnum
group.description: Total HIp Arthroplasty using with the M2a Magnum Large Metal Articulation is an ultra-high performance metal-on-metal articulation with a big ball (greater than or equal to 38mm) in acetabulums as small as 44mm. Total Hip Arthroplasty: Degenerated hip is replaced with implantable devices, which include femoral stem, acetabular cup, femoral head and acetabular liner(control group only).

group.title: M2a Taper
group.description: Total Hip Arthroplasty using with the M2a Taper Acetabular System consists of a titanium outer shell with cobalt chromium (Co-Cr-Mo) metallic liner, which articulates with with a cobalt chromium (Co-Cr-Mo) modular femoral head. Total Hip Arthroplasty: Degenerated hip is replaced with implantable devices, which include femoral stem, acetabular cup, femoral head and acetabular liner(control group only).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Harris Hip Score
measure.description: Harris Hip Score is physician assessing hip functional scoring system, which includes 4 components (pain, function, deformity and range of motion) with minimum score of 0 & maximum score of 100. Maximum & Minimum score of each subscale is pain: 0-44, function: 0-47, Deformity: 0-4 and Range of motion: 0-5. Current report uses summed score of each patient to compare total Harris Hip Score. Higher score means better outcomes.
measure.population: Preoperative Harris Hip Score of two patients in Magnum arm were failed to obtain.

measure.title: EQ-5D
measure.description: EQ-5D is patient reported outcome measure to score patient's health related quality of life with minimum score of -0.111 and maximum score of 1.000. Higher score means better outcomes.
measure.population: Preoperative EQ-5D questionnaire was not completed by two subjects (one subject each arm).

measure.title: UCLA Activity Score
measure.description: UCLA is physician assessing scoring system to assess patient's activity level. Minimum score is 0 (completely inactive) and maximum score is 9 (Regularly participates in impact sports) with 1 point increments depending on patient's activity level. Higher score means higher activity level achieved.

outcome.title: Range of Motion
outcome.description: Hip Flexion Angle at 1 year postoperatively
outcome.population: 2 patients in M2a Magnum group and 4 patients in M2a Taper group were failed to obtain Range of Motion data at 1 year follow-up visit.

outcome.title: Radiographic Assessment
outcome.description: number of participants, whose x-ray shows any signs of radiographic changes (osteolysis, heterotopic ossification and/or radiolucency)
outcome.population: 45 patients in M2a Magnum group and 36 patients in M2a Taper group were failed to be assessed radiographically at 5 year follow-up visit.

event.sub_title: Revision due to Adverse Reaction to Metal Debris

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
